results.title: Rape. Part 1. Problems in proof
results.creator_credit: AIMS Instructional Media, Karen Smith, Richard Cullather and Richard Siegel
results.brief_description: Demonstrates the value of careful investigation, corroboration of the victim’s allegation of rape and the primary responsibility of the investigating officer. Studies evidentiary problems encountered at trial.

results.title: Rape culture
results.creator_credit: Cambridge Documentary Films, Margaret Margaret Lazarus and Renner Wunderlich
results.brief_description: This film explores those elements in our society which contribute to the ideology that supports rape. It attempts to expand our society’s narrow and sexist concept of rape and establishes the connections between violence and “normal” patterns of male-female behaviour. Includes the opinions of convicted rapists, rape crisis centre workers, and others associated with the problem.

results.title: Rap race and equality
results.creator_credit: Elliott Productions, Burberry Productions, Stephen Elliott and Grant Elliott
results.brief_description: Rap and hip-hop were musical genres that developed within the African-American subcultures of America’s largest cities. Fusing funk, disco and a do-it-yourself punk aesthetic, rap music quickly became the defining voice of a generation of young, angry and disenfranchised black youth. In this incisive documentary, the history of rap and hip-hop is explored as well as the larger social context of American race and class relations. Interviews with Ice-T, Queen latifah, KRS-One, Chuck D and Rakim explore the context of rap’s evolution and offer necessary defences of the music’s relevance and importance to African-American youth; especially in the context of a popular media that has often dismissed rap as misogynist or “inauthentic”. Made by two Australian brothers who fell in love with the music, this documentary gives a voice to the power, impact, originality and importance of rap and hip-hop.

results.title: Raoul Wallenberg: between the lines [Edited version]
results.creator_credit: Bob Weis, Jethro Films Pty Ltd and Karin Altmann
results.brief_description: The story of Raoul Wallenberg, a Swedish diplomat living in wartime Budapest who displayed outstanding courage and ingenuity in rescuing Jews from the holocaust. An edited version of the 80 minute feature length documentary.

results.title: Rangipukea
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Vanessa James and ACMI
results.brief_description: Vanessa James talks about the island just off the end of the farm that her family used to own. There they would farm sheep and cattle over the years and throughout the generations.

results.title: Range sheep
results.brief_description: Shows the feeding of orphan lambs from bottles, and the shearing, marking, counting, and pasturing of sheep in the summer. Points out that some fo the sheep are marketed in the fall, while the rest of the flock is cared for in the winter.

results.title: Range of experience
results.creator_credit: Lisa Duff, Marc Gillezeau, Maryella Hatfield and AFTRS
results.brief_description:
It is the future - a world where the ability to experience life’s basic emotions has been lost to humanity and Virtual Reality has replaced dreams. The company Range of Experience Productions Inc has invented the Dream Base Selector, a machine which enables users to re-live experiences once created naturally by the subconscious mind. But it soon becomes apparent that the technology is slightly faulty…
Cast: Soledad Cordeaux
